==Events==
* [[307]] &ndash; After divorcing his wife [[Minervina]], [[Constantine the Great|Constantine]] marries [[Fausta]], the daughter of the retired [[Roman Emperor]] [[Maximian]].
* [[627]] &ndash; [[Battle of the Trench]]: [[Muhammad]] undergoes a 14-day [[siege]] at [[Medina]] ([[Saudi Arabia]]) by [[Mecca]]n forces under [[Abu Sufyan ibn Harb|Abu Sufyan]].
*[[1146]] &ndash; [[Bernard of Clairvaux]] preaches his famous sermon in a field at [[Vézelay]], urging the necessity of a [[Second Crusade]].  [[Louis VII of France|Louis VII]] is present, and joins the Crusade.
*[[1492]] &ndash; [[Isabella I of Castile|Queen Isabella]] of Castille issues the [[Alhambra Decree]], ordering her 150,000 Jewish and Muslim subjects to convert to Christianity or face expulsion.
*[[1561]] &ndash; The city of [[San Cristóbal, Táchira]] is founded.
*[[1717]] &ndash; A [[sermon]] on "The Nature of the Kingdom of Christ" by [[Benjamin Hoadly]], the [[Bishop of Bangor]], provokes the [[Bangorian Controversy]].
*[[1774]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: The Kingdom of Great Britain orders the port of [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]] closed pursuant to the [[Boston Port Act]].
*[[1822]] &ndash; [[Chios Massacre|The massacre of the population]] of the Greek island of [[Chios]] by soldiers of the [[Ottoman Empire]] following an attempted rebellion, depicted by the French artist [[Eugène Delacroix]].
*[[1854]] &ndash; [[Commodore (United States)|Commodore]] [[Matthew Perry (naval officer)|Matthew Perry]] signs the [[Treaty of Kanagawa]] with the Japanese government, opening the ports of [[Shimoda, Shizuoka|Shimoda]] and [[Hakodate]] to American trade.
*[[1866]] &ndash; The Spanish Navy bombs the harbor of [[Valparaíso]], Chile.
*[[1877]] &ndash; The family with [[samurai]] antecedents that responded to the [[Saigō Takamori|Saigō]] army in [[Ōita Prefecture|Ōita]] Nakatsu, rebels.
*[[1885]] &ndash; The United Kingdom establishes a [[protectorate]] over [[Bechuanaland]].
*[[1889]] &ndash; The [[Eiffel Tower]] is officially opened.
*[[1899]] &ndash; [[Malolos]], capital of the [[First Philippine Republic]], [[Capture of Malolos|was captured by American forces]].
*[[1901]] &ndash; [[1901 Black Sea earthquake]].
*[[1903]] &ndash; [[Richard Pearse]] allegedly makes a powered flight in an early aircraft.
*[[1906]] &ndash; The Intercollegiate Athletic Association of the United States (later the [[National Collegiate Athletic Association]]) is established to set rules for college [[sport]]s in the United States.
*[[1909]] &ndash; [[Serbia]] accepts Austrian control over [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]].
*  1909   &ndash; Construction of the ill fated [[RMS Titanic]] begins.
*[[1910]] &ndash; Six North Staffordshire Pottery towns federate to form modern [[Stoke-on-Trent]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; The Vienna Concert Society rioted during a performance of modernist music by [[Arnold Schoenberg]], [[Alban Berg]], [[Alexander von Zemlinsky]], and [[Anton von Webern]], causing a premature end to the concert due to violence; this concert became known as the [[Skandalkonzert]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; The United States takes possession of the [[Danish West Indies]] after paying $25 million to Denmark, and renames the territory the [[United States Virgin Islands]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[March Days|Massacre of ethnic Azerbaijanis]] is committed by allied armed groups of [[Armenian Revolutionary Federation]] and [[Bolsheviks]]. Nearly 12,000 Azerbaijani Muslims are killed.
*  1918   &ndash; [[Daylight saving time]] goes into effect in the United States for the first time.
*[[1921]] &ndash; The [[Royal Australian Air Force]] is formed.
*[[1930]] &ndash; The [[Motion Picture Production Code]] is instituted, imposing strict guidelines on the treatment of sex, crime, religion and violence in film, in the U.S., for the next thirty-eight years.
*[[1931]] &ndash; An [[1931 Nicaragua earthquake|earthquake]] destroys [[Managua]], Nicaragua, killing 2,000.
*  1931   &ndash; [[TWA Flight 599]] crashes near [[Bazaar, Kansas]], killing eight, including [[University of Notre Dame]] head football coach [[Knute Rockne]].<!--Resulted in regulations-->
*[[1933]] &ndash; The [[Civilian Conservation Corps]] is established with the mission of relieving rampant unemployment in the United States.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Battle of Christmas Island|Japanese forces invade Christmas Island]], then a British possession.
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: a defecting German pilot delivers a [[Messerschmitt Me 262A-1]], the world's first operational [[Turbojet|jet-powered]] [[fighter aircraft]], to the Americans, the first to fall into Allied hands.
*[[1949]] &ndash; The [[Dominion of Newfoundland]] joins the [[Canadian Confederation]] and becomes the 10th [[Provinces of Canada|Province]] of Canada.
*[[1951]] &ndash; [[Remington Rand]] delivers the first [[UNIVAC I]] computer to the [[United States Census Bureau]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Upper Volta Territorial Assembly election, 1957|Elections to the Territorial Assembly]] of the French colony [[French Upper Volta|Upper Volta]] are held. After the elections [[Unified Democratic Party|PDU]] and [[Voltaic Democratic Movement|MDV]] form a government.
*[[1958]] &ndash; In the [[Canadian federal election, 1958|Canadian federal election]], the [[Progressive Conservative Party of Canada|Progressive Conservatives]], led by [[John Diefenbaker]], win the largest percentage of seats in Canadian history, with 208 seats of 265.
*[[1959]] &ndash; The [[14th Dalai Lama]], crosses the border into India and is granted [[political asylum]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; A [[1964 Brazilian coup d'état|coup d'état in Brazil]] establishes a [[Brazilian military government|military government]], under the aegis of general [[Humberto de Alencar Castelo Branco|Castelo Branco]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] launches [[Luna 10]] which later becomes the first [[space probe]] to enter orbit around the Moon.
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Explorer 1]] re-enters the Earth's atmosphere after 12 years in orbit.
*[[1979]] &ndash; The last British soldier leaves the [[Malta|Maltese Islands]]. Malta declares its Freedom Day (Jum il-Helsien).
*[[1980]] &ndash; The [[Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad]] operates its final train after being ordered to liquidate its assets because of bankruptcy and debts owed to creditors.
*[[1985]] &ndash; The first [[WrestleMania]], the biggest wrestling event from the WWE (then the WWF), takes place in [[Madison Square Garden]] in New York.
*[[1986]] &ndash; Six [[metropolitan county]] councils are abolished in England.
*[[1990]] &ndash; Approximately [[Poll Tax Riots|200,000 protestors take to the streets]] of London to protest against the newly introduced [[Poll Tax]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Georgian independence referendum, 1991]]: Nearly 99 percent of the voters support the country's independence from the Soviet Union.
*[[1992]] &ndash; The {{USS|Missouri|BB-63|6}}, the last active United States Navy [[battleship]], is decommissioned in [[Long Beach, California]].
*[[1994]] &ndash; The journal ''[[Nature (journal)|Nature]]'' reports the finding in [[Ethiopia]] of the first complete ''[[Australopithecus afarensis]]'' skull.
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Iraq War in Anbar Province]]: In [[Fallujah]], Iraq, four American [[private military contractor]]s working for [[Blackwater USA]], are killed after being [[31 March 2004 Fallujah ambush|ambushed]].
